pr_title: SAMZA-2551: Upgrade all modules to automatically use checkstyle 6.11.2 (part 3: includes samza-kafka)

timeline.message: SAMZA-2551: Upgrade all modules to automatically use checkstyle 6.11.2 (part 2: includes samza-kafka)
update after merge with other checkstyle changes

timeline.author: sborya

timeline.bodyText: why do we allow unused imports?
timeline.author: sborya
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,7 +25,10 @@
   <suppress checks="ConstantName"
             files="ApplicationStatus.java"
             lines="26-29"/>
+  <!-- don't require FQDNs to be used in API javadocs -->
   <suppress id="preventJavadocUnusedImports"
             files=".*samza-api.*"/>
+  <!-- don't require FQDNs to be used in descriptor javadocs -->
+  <suppress files="samza-kafka/src/main/java/org/apache/samza/system/kafka/descriptors" id="preventJavadocUnusedImports" />

replies.bodyText:
In the descriptor classes, the javadocs may include references to some other classes which aren't directly used in the code (e.g. through {@link <className>}). For API classes like descriptors, it is nice to be able to just use the simple class name (e.g. {@link MyClass}) instead of the full qualified name (e.g. {@link org.apache.samza.MyClass}).
I will clarify the the comment.
